title: ArianeGroup to Receive €340M Per Year to Operate Ariane 6
summary:
Member states of the European Space Agency have committed to provide ArianeGroup with up to €340 million a year to operate Ariane 6. In addition to subsidies for Ariane 6, it was also agreed that €21 million per year would be provided for the operation of Vega C. ESA is currently working towards a major […]
The post ArianeGroup to Receive €340M Per Year to Operate Ariane 6 appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Daily Telescope: Pumping up the volume with the Headphones nebula

title: Getting inflight Wi-Fi up to speed
summary: While growing demand for Wi-Fi on planes is a significant growth opportunity for satellite capacity providers, the pandemic has held back its upward climb alongside a decline in air travel. However, the inflight connectivity (IFC) market is preparing for some major lift as air traffic fast approaches pre-pandemic levels.

title: ESA: Time to Assert Europe’s “Rightful Place” in Space
summary: The ministers of the European Space Agency’s member states today committed to a “paradigm shift” in the European space program and “asserting Europe’s rightful place in the world.” Meeting as […]
